result.execSummary:
The defendant Eden Saat Malave Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to count 3; with 68 days credit

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.

- Complete a psychological or psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment or services.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eden Saat Malave Jr

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 68 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence AND CONSECUTIVE to Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence AND CONSECUTIVE to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- Maintain employment. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Complete a psychological or psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment or services.
- AS TO COUNT 1: Driver's license revoked for a period of 6 MONTHS.
- AS TO COUNT 3: Driver's license revoked for a period of 6 MONTHS..
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- Restitution set at $0.00.


Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Eden Saat Malave Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Eden Saat Malave Jr.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to pleas, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 AND 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court  via zoom, defendant Eden Saat Malave not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court will accept case 22CM617 for global resolution. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Filings Due scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Eden Saat Malave in court, appear by video with attorney Jason A Findling, appear by video.  Defendant Eden Saat Malave in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving.

Defendant Eden Saat Malave in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Eden Saat Malave in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eden Saat Malave appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
